title: Falcons accused Patriots of illegal simulation of a snap on crucial fourth quarter play
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Falcons accused the Patriots of simulating a snap during a crucial fourth quarter play in their 24-23 loss.
Atlanta's coach Raheem Morris and quarterback Michael Penix Jr. claimed New England mimicked Penix Jr.'s snap signal.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel dismissed the accusations, attributing noise to fans' energy during the game.

title: A Worcester woman has been missing since leaving work Friday morning
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Joanna Brown, 30, was last seen leaving Bean Counter Bakery Cafe in Worcester at 9 a.m. Friday.
Police believe she might be in the Holyoke or Springfield area, driving a 2025 Gray Mitsubishi Outlander.
Anyone with information about Brown's whereabouts should contact Worcester Police at 508-799-8606.

title: ‘Clapgate’: Mike Vrabel responded to Falcons’ accusations of Patriots’ illegal clapping
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Falcons accused Patriots of simulating a snap with clapping, affecting a crucial play; Mike Vrabel denied any wrongdoing.
Wide receiver DeMario Douglas played despite learning his uncle was killed; Mike Vrabel expressed support for Douglas.
Patriots head coach Vrabel defended the team's schedule strength and discussed potential moves before the NFL trade deadline.

title: Lululemon shoplifting spree continues in Boston
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston Lululemon shops faced their third shoplifting incident in just over a month, latest occurring on Boylston Street.
The most recent theft on Sunday evening involved an undisclosed number of suspects; no arrests have been made.
Previous incidents involved thefts of $700 and $6,600 worth of merchandise from Prudential Center and Newbury Street stores.

title: Two Red Sox outfielders earn Gold Glove Awards
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox outfielders Wilyer Abreu and Ceddanne Rafaela won 2025 Rawlings Gold Glove Awards.
Abreu earned his second consecutive A.L. Gold Glove for right field with eight Outs Above Average.
Rafaela won his first Gold Glove in center field, leading with 21 Outs Above Average.

title: Middle school principal in Maine draws criticism after dressing as ICE agent for Halloween
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: James Black, principal of Mt. Blue Middle School, criticized for dressing as an ICE agent for Halloween.
The incident, involving the controversial costume, took place off school grounds and unrelated to district activities.
Project Relief Maine stated the costume is traumatizing for immigrant students, emphasizing deportation should not be a joke.

title: What Christian Gonzalez said about his head injury
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots cornerback Christian Gonzalez left the game with a head injury but was cleared after concussion protocol.
Gonzalez's injury happened during a play with Atlanta's Drake London, who caught a 40-yard pass over him.
Despite the injury, Gonzalez was ready to return but remained out as the Patriots secured their win.

title: South End residents say they picked up 180 needles in less than a week at neighborhood park
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: South End residents collected 180 needles in six days near Southwest Corridor Park, highlighting concerns over public safety.
Boston distributes over 81,000 needles monthly as a harm reduction measure, sparking debate over excessive distribution.
Councilor Ed Flynn calls for increased needle pick-up resources and coordination between Boston officials and the DA's office.

title: What Kevin Durant said about Jayson Tatum’s Achilles recovery, chances of returning this year
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kevin Durant praised Jayson Tatum's recovery from an Achilles injury, noting he's ahead of his own recovery timeline.
Tatum is already dunking just six months post-surgery, showing significant progress compared to Durant's similar past injury.
Durant considers a return feasible for Tatum this season, emphasizing Tatum's determination to play despite the timeline.

title: Amid tragedy, childhood friends DeMario Douglas and Terrell Jennings persevere in Patriots’ win
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' DeMario Douglas achieved his first 100-yard game against the Falcons, despite mourning a family loss.
Terrell Jennings, recently added to the active roster, scored his first NFL touchdown, helping the Patriots secure victory.
Both players, childhood friends from Jacksonville, honored their late uncle with standout performances in the 24-23 win.
